com.wingfoot.xml.schema.groups
Class AttributeGroupDefinition

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.wingfoot.xml.schema.Component
        |
        +--com.wingfoot.xml.schema.groups.AttributeGroupDefinition
All Implemented Interfaces:
Group
public class AttributeGroupDefinition
extends Component
implements Group

A schema can name a group of attribute declaration so that they may be incorporated as a group into complex type definition. This group is known as Attribute Group definition.

When used in complex type definition, the effect is as if the attribute declarations in the group were present in the type definition.

Attribute groups are identified by their name and targetNamespace and must be unique within a schema.

Note that an attribute group declaration must appear at the end of complex type definition.

An attribute group definition might contain a ref attribute that is a reference to a previously declared attribute group. If the ref attribute is not present, it indicates that a new attribute group is being defined. The content of the <attributeGroup> is a set of <attribute> AND/OR <attributeGroup> with the ref attribute.

Constructor Detail

AttributeGroupDefinition

public AttributeGroupDefinition(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String targetNamespace)
                         throws SchemaException
Creates an instance of AttributeGroupDefinition. Once created, the name and targetNamespace of the AttributeGroupDefinition cannot be changed.
Parameters:
name - Name of the AttributeGroupDefinition. The name is mandatory.
targetNamespace - String with the targetNamespace defined in the <schema> element; null if none is defined.
isReference - true if the attribute group is a reference to another attribute group; false if this is a new attribute group definition.
Throws:
SchemaException - if the name is null

AttributeGroupDefinition

public AttributeGroupDefinition(QName ref)
Creates a AttributeGroupDefinition that is a reference to another attribute group. Such <attributeGroup> have a ref attribute and DO NOT have a name attribute. They DO NOT have any content model either.
Parameters:
ref - QName of the AttributeGroupDefinition being referred to.
Method Detail

isReference

public boolean isReference()
Determines if the AttributeGroupDefinition is a definition or a reference to another AttributeGroupDefinition.
Specified by:
isReference in interface Group
Returns:
boolean true is a reference; false otherwise.

getTargetNamespace

public java.lang.String getTargetNamespace()
Returns the targetNamespace of the AttributeGroup. The targetNamespace is optional.
Specified by:
getTargetNamespace in interface Group
Returns:
String the targetNamespace; null if no namespace is associated to the AttributeGroup.

setContent

public void setContent(Component content)
                throws SchemaException
An AttributeGroup is a group of attributes. Provides the ability to add an attribute to the attribute group.
Specified by:
setContent in interface Group
Parameters:
content - an Attribute to be added as a content to the AttributeGroup.
Throws:
SchemaException - if the content is other than Attribute or AttributeGroup.

setContent

public void setContent(java.util.Vector content)
                throws SchemaException
Sets the content of the attributeGroup. Any previous content is completely lost.
Parameters:
content - a Vector of Attribute and AttributeGroup. These are the only two valid componenets in a attributeGroup.
content - a Vector of components.
Throws:
SchemaException - if an invalid content model was detected.

Specified by:

Returns:
Vector the content of the AttributeGroup Each element of the List is an instance of Attribute; returns null if the content of the AttributeGroup is empty.

getAllAttributes

public Attribute[] getAllAttributes()
Retrieves all the Attributes in the AttributeGroup. If the AttributeGroup contains another AttributeGroup then the nested AttributeGroup is recursed to include all the Attributes.
Returns:
Attribute[] array of all the Attributes in the AttributeGroup.
